Topic.Title: OBAMA IS THE ENEMY!

Message.Msg: That NWO schtick has been around for a long time, like the 19030's at least. And in all that time, no international, super-secretive conspiracy to simultaneously impose godless communism upon the all countries of the world has been discovered, let alone any hint of it's actual implementation. In fact, with the utter collapse of the Soviet Union , the obvious embrace of Chinese communists to free market/enterprise policies, it's getting rather difficult to find a bonafide #$%$. Tough luck for you and your conspiracy cooks and dealers, eh? So you and your warped worldview warlords have adapted to the times...now it's Agenda 21 that's the world-wide conspiracy that you wackos have selected as the propaganda vehicle. Of course, it's the toothless and ineffective United Nations that's behind all this, just like NWO scheme before. Which is hilarious, 'cause the UN couldn't plan a surprise birthday party, let alone a world-wide conspiracy. Too-freakin-funny! Here's your boogeyman...from wikipedia...."Agenda 21 is a non-binding, voluntarily implemented action plan of the United Nations with regards to sustainable development. It is a product of the UN Conference on Environment and Development (UNCED) held in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, in 1992" And why would you "folks" be against that? Money, power and control; and the sub-humans that demonize progressive efforts like this are big corporations, super rich power broker SOBs and of, course, The Republican party of the US, always ready to prostitute themselves for the sake of money and power. The health and welfare of the common citizen is a concern of little importance, simply an irritant ,to their certainty that..."we know that what's best for US is best for YOU too....(whether you know or like it or not)".

Message.Title: this week, pre-thanksgiving 2012
Message.Msg: This week, pre-Thanksgiving 2012 Perhaps the tone of the program was set near its end, when the sent in query, about focus upon Petraeus and upon Benghazi rather than upon Afghanistan, was answered. Americans are weary of Afghanistan, they have in mind the exit in 2014. Such being the case, the ultimate sacrifices of five in the USA military—two from Calif, one Oregon and nearby Washington, the other North Carolina, ages 20s and one past 35—were mentioned but not stressed. Earlier, queries about Benghazi and Petraeus. The general’s “mistake” was a personal one, not impeding USA security. The talking points given the UN ambassador were, well, “given’ to be used, not scrutinized by the ambassador. Context from Sen Levin of Mich, and GOP’s questioning King of N Y S. Discussion of “fiscal cliff” past speaker of House Nancy Pelosi responses. Matter more serious than 18 months ago, if president says the affluent should pay a ”fair share” higher tax rate, well such is his party’s position. Roundtable, Dem House leadership Xavier Becarra stated “peace process” Israel’s best defense. Past speaker Newton Gingrich considers Petraeus to have been in a difficult position and the head of the CIA must show good judgment. Re fiscal cliff Becarra stresses “all” is on the table. Gingrich fears tax increases will be voted, but spending cuts delayed and finessed—baad development, of course. He called the Mitt Romney quote to GOP governors about Democratic “gifts” winning the election unwise (OK paraphrase). Sponsors, mostly the same, the two BP ones repeat of the same ad, two different IBM ones, ditto the Dell ads. Yes natural gas pressure group, and somewhat analogous one from Chevron. No BAC but again Pacific life. Martha Raddatz, not Geo Stephanopoulos, was moderator.

If we can't offer a better future that is believable to more people, we're not going to win,” said Gingrich, who launched blistering attacks on Romney last spring while seeking the presidential nomination himself.

Topic.Title: WHEN HILLARY ASKED FOR $300 ON AUGUST 12 FOR EMBASSY SECURITY. WAS VETO BY PAUL RYAN

Message.Msg: From the Drudge Report, facts that are easy to prove: Paul Ryan, Darrell Issa and other House Republicans voted for an amendment in 2009 to cut $1.2 billion from State operations, including funds for 300 more diplomatic security positions. Under Ryan's budget, non-defense discretionary spending, which includes State Department funding, would be slashed nearly 20 percent in 2014, which would translate to more than $400 million in additional cuts to embassy security. For fiscal 2013, the GOP-controlled House proposed spending $1.934 billion for the State Department's worldwide security protection program -- well below the $2.15 billion requested by the Obama administration. House Republicans cut the administration's request for embassy security funding by $128 million in fiscal 2011 and $331 million in fiscal 2012. (Negotiations with the Democrat-controlled Senate restored about $88 million of the administration's request.) Last year, Secretary of State Hillary Clinton warned that Republicans' proposed cuts to her department would be "detrimental to America's national security" -- a charge Republicans rejected.

Message.Title: Something to think about-Wash Post
Message.Msg: There are a historic number of GOP governors. Next year, 30 states will be run by Republicans — the highest number for either party in more than a decade. Those 30 chief executives include Jindal and Christie, who are already getting major 2016 buzz, and also New Mexico’s Susana Martinez, the first Hispanic woman elected governor from either party, and Nevada’s Brian Sandoval, a Hispanic former federal judge. Both are likely to play leading roles in the party’s attempts to court Latino voters. And then there are the other 26 governors who all will have real opportunities to rebrand the Republican Party based on how they choose to govern between now and 2016. (Keep an eye on Indiana’s Mike Pence, who has designs on a national candidacy down the line.) Remember that when the Democratic Party found itself in the political wilderness after the 1988 election, it turned to its governors — including the boy wonder from Arkansas — for ideas on how to remake itself. And we know how that turned out.
